title.narrative: Rapid Response Child-Focused Social Cash Transfer and Nutrition Security Project

description.narrative: The PDO is to reduce the risk of nutrition insecurity of vulnerable populations, in particular children under five in poor rural and urban areas by scaling up the Government Nutrition Enhancement Program and providing cash transfers to vulnerable mothers of children under five.

title.narrative: Pregnant women making at least 4 prenatal care visits

comment.narrative: Area specific baseline will be available within 4 months of effectiveness.
Target will be 30 percentage points above the baseline
It seems unlikely that the target will be met when the project closes in three months. Source: LQAS surveys.
Number of beneficiaries of cash transfer program
The project has caught up with the initial delay and has surpassed the end-of-project target. (Source: Project Monitoring System)

title.narrative: Quantity of salt adequately iodized by small producers

comment.narrative: tons
tons
While last year's production surpassed the project target; this year's production falls short. Source: Project Monitoring System

title.narrative: Children under age five treated for moderate or severe acute malnutrition (number)

comment.narrative: (Source:Project Monitoring System)

title.narrative: Transfers made by local payment service providers

comment.narrative: The result has surpassed the end of project target. (Source: Project Monitoring System)

title.narrative: Selected beneficiaries who do not meet eligibility criteria (inclusion error)

comment.narrative: The target is to stay below 20% and this result is well below the target (Source: Project Monitoring System)

title.narrative: Local Governments incorporating nutrition objectives and interventions in Local Development Plans

comment.narrative: This result has surpassed the end-of-project targets. (Source: Project Monitoring System)

title.narrative: Children 6-59 months screened for acute malnutrition

comment.narrative: This result is above the target of 80%. (Source: Project Monitoring System)

title.narrative: Selected beneficiaries who receive all intended cash transfers

comment.narrative: This result is above the target of 80%. Each "cohort" has shown similar high coverage. (Source: Project Monitoring System)

title.narrative: Quantity of adequatly fortified oil with vitamin A by oil industry (litres)

comment.narrative: This year's result is not on track to reach the target. Last year, production reached close to 45000 tons. (Source: ProjectMonitoring System)

title.narrative: Children between the age of 6 and 59 months receiving Vitamin A supplementation (number)

comment.narrative: Update is not possible due to the strike in the health system whereby all data is being retained. (Source: Project MonitoringSystem)

title.narrative: Children under the age of 24 months benefiting from improved infant and young child feeding (IYCF) practices (number)

comment.narrative: Project is well above the end-of-project target(Source: Project Monitoring System).
The result has surpassed the end of project target. (Source: LQAS surveys).

title.narrative: Children 0-24 months showing adequate weight gain

comment.narrative: Results are above end of project target of 75% (Source: Project Monitoring System).

comment.narrative: Results are above end of project target. (Source: LQAS)

comment.narrative: Results are above end of project target. (Source: Project Monitoring System).

comment.narrative: The result has surpassed the end of project target. (Source: Project Monitoring System)

title.narrative: Targeted children in primary education receiving weekly micronutrient supplements

comment.narrative: This result is above the target of 80%. (Source: Project Monitoring System)

title.narrative: Development and adoption by the government of an efficient child-focused social cash transfer scheme as part of the NSPS

comment.narrative: Both, the social cash transfer to mothers of vulnerable children under five and the community targeting system have been adoptedbyGovernment.

title.narrative: Pregnant women receiving iron and folic acid (IFA) supplements (number)

comment.narrative: Project promotes antenatal care and thereby the use of IFA supplements. This indicator however is not measured by the project

title.narrative: Pregnant/lactating women, adolescent girls and/or children under age five- reached by basic nutrition services – Others (specify)

comment.narrative: This sub-indicator is not followed by the project(Source: Project Monitoring System)
